author: M Dinesh Varma
text:
A rider participates in the Equestrian Challenge 2016 in Puducherry on Friday.— PHOTO: M. Samraj

Horse riders from across India flaunted their skills at the show jumping events on the opening day of the Pondicherry Equestrian Challenge at Auroville on Friday.

The event, which is growing in stature in the equestrian circuit, is co-hosted by Red Earth Riding School (RERS), Auroville, and Equestrian Promotion Private Limited (EPP) with support of the Department of Tourism.

About 60 riders from Puducherry, Chennai, Bengaluru, Coimbatore, Mumbai, apart from international riders including three from France and one from the U.S.A, are participating.

About 35 riders participated in the 90cm, 100cm, 110cm and 120cm categories on the opening day at the end of which Flora from Team Marcott Bengaluru won in the 90cm show jumping event (adult); Jibran from ECE, Bengaluru won in the under 18 event, Nandhini Delphin from Red Earth Riding School won the 100cm segment, Bharath from ECE Bengaluru in the 110 cm segment and Gregory from RERS in the 120 cm.

The dressage events, which are a different ball game altogether in terms of harmony between rider and the horse, commence on March 3.

Performances at the International Dressage Development League (IDDL) competition will be judged by Fédération Équestre Internationale, an international federation for equestrian sports.
title: Show jumping skills on display at equestrian meet
